intro: Codonopsis microtubulosa, commonly known as the Chinese bellflower, is a herbaceous perennial native to China. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, tubular flowers that range in color from white to violet. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers partial to full sun, making it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its showy blooms that appear in summer.
